description:
# Attack System

This extension includes several behaviors which work with the the FireBullet and Health extensions to create a complete attack system. The behaviors are Attack, HandheldItem, SwingItem, and HealthBar.

## Attack Behavior Setup
There will typically be between two and four objects: the Attacker, the Target, the Weapon, and the Bullet. To set them up:
1. Add the Health behavior to both the Attacker and the Target.
2. Add the Attack behavior to the Attacker.
3. Add either the FireBullet or SwingingItem behavior to the Weapon (if there is one).
4. On each frame, use the appropriate "Check X damage" action for the type of attack.
5. Use the "Attack by..." actions to attack, either by swinging or by firing (or both, or neither).
    - The action can be invoked in response to an event, like a key press, or it can be run on every frame to auto-attack.

The attack damage, interval, range, direction, and speed can be configured in the Attack behavior properties. The Attack behavior also maintains a death count and a kill count for the attacker.

## Swinging Behaviors

This also includes behaviors which allow an object to be held and swung like a sword. There are two behaviors which tend to go together, although they could be used separately (e.g. a non-swinging item, like a key).

1. HandheldItem: An object with this behavior can be held by another object at a named point.
    - For the object holding the item, create a custom point or move the "Center" or "Origin" points to wherever the object should be held (the "hand"). 
    - For the item being held, move the "Center" point to wherever the object should be held (like the hilt of a sword).
2. SwingingItem: An object in this behavior can be swung like a sword.
    - You can configure the starting angle, swing speed and swing arc length.
    - The swing can follow the rotation of the object holding the item.

# Health Bar

As a bonus, this extension includes a behavior for a health bar which can hover above a character and change in response to the character's health.

This works with the "Health" extension to display health information in a health bar which can also hover over the character. 

To use it:
1. Add the HealthBar behavior to the object.
2. Attach the health bar to the object using the "Attach health bar" action.
3. Update the health bar every frame using the "Update health bar" action.
name: Attack
shortDescription: Have an object attack and do damage to another object using an optional melee or a ranged weapon.

eventsFunctions.description: Create a health bar and attach it to an object.
eventsFunctions.name: AttachHealthBar

parameters.description: Character to attach the health bar to
parameters.name: Character

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: An object which can attack a target with a ranged or melee weapon.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Attack

eventsFunctions.description: Attack a target and deal damage if they are in range.
eventsFunctions.name: Attack

parameters.longDescription: This controls whether the object attacks always, whenever it is ready, even when not in range of the target. If the attack is triggered for specific events, like a key release, then this should probably be set to "Yes". If the attack is run on every frame to have the character auto-attack, then this should probably be set to "No".
parameters.name: AttackAlways

eventsFunctions.description: Attack a target if they are in range by swinging a weapon.
eventsFunctions.name: AttackSwing
eventsFunctions.sentence: Have _PARAM0_ attack _PARAM2_ by swinging weapon _PARAM4_ (swing always, when ready _PARAM6_)

parameters.longDescription: This controls whether the object swings the weapon always, whenever it is ready, even when not in range of the target. If the attack is triggered for specific events, like a key release, then this should probably be set to "Yes". If the attack is run on every frame to have the character auto-attack, then this should probably be set to "No".
parameters.name: SwingAlways

eventsFunctions.description: Attack a target by firing a weapon using a bullet or other projectile.
eventsFunctions.name: AttackFire
eventsFunctions.sentence: Have _PARAM0_ attack _PARAM2_ by firing _PARAM4_ from point _PARAM6_;_PARAM7_ using bullet _PARAM8_ (fire always, when ready _PARAM9_, auto-aim _PARAM10_)

parameters.longDescription: This controls whether the object fires the weapon always, whenever it is ready, even when not in range of the target. If the attack is triggered for specific events, like a key release, then this should typically be set to "Yes". If the attack is run on every frame to have the character auto-attack, then this should typically be set to "No".
parameters.name: FireAlways

parameters.longDescription: This controls whether the object automatically aims the weapon to fire at the target when it is in range. When this is set to "No", the attacker will fire in the attack direction. When set to "Yes", the attacker will fire directly at the target, but only when they are in range.
parameters.name: AutoAim

eventsFunctions.description: Attack a target by swinging and firing a weapon with a bullet or other projectile.
eventsFunctions.name: AttackFireSwing
eventsFunctions.sentence: Have _PARAM0_ attack _PARAM2_ by swinging and firing _PARAM4_ from point _PARAM7_;_PARAM8_ using bullet _PARAM9_ (fire always, when ready _PARAM10_, auto-aim _PARAM11_)

parameters.description: X position of the point to fire from
parameters.name: PointX

parameters.description: Y position of the point to fire from
parameters.name: PointY

parameters.longDescription: This controls whether the object fires the weapon always, whenever it is ready, even when not in range of the target. If the attack is triggered for specific events, like a key release, then this should typically be set to "Yes". If the attack is run on every frame to have the character auto-attack, then this should typically be set to "No".
parameters.name: FireAlways

parameters.longDescription: This controls whether the object automatically aims the weapon to fire at the target when it is in range. When this is set to "No", the attacker will fire in the attack direction. When set to "Yes", the attacker will fire directly at the target, but only when they are in range.
parameters.name: AutoAim

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the bullet is damaging the target.
eventsFunctions.name: CheckBullet
eventsFunctions.sentence: Check if _PARAM0_ is damaging _PARAM2_ with bullet _PARAM4_

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the swinging item is damaging the character.
eventsFunctions.name: CheckSwing
eventsFunctions.sentence: Check if _PARAM0_ is damaging _PARAM2_ by swinging _PARAM4_

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the attack is damaging the character.
eventsFunctions.name: CheckAttack
eventsFunctions.sentence: Check if _PARAM0_ is damaging _PARAM2_ by attacking

eventsFunctions.description: Set how often to attack, in seconds.
eventsFunctions.name: SetAttackInterval
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the _PARAM0_ attack interval to _PARAM2_ seconds

parameters.description: How often to attack, in seconds
parameters.name: Interval

eventsFunctions.description: Get the attack interval, in seconds.
eventsFunctions.name: AttackInterval

eventsFunctions.description: Set the damage done by the attack.
eventsFunctions.name: SetAttackDamage

eventsFunctions.description: Get the damage done by the attack.
eventsFunctions.name: AttackDamage

eventsFunctions.description: Set the range of the attack, in pixels.
eventsFunctions.name: SetAttackRange
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the _PARAM0_ attack range to _PARAM2_ pixels

eventsFunctions.description: Get the range of the attack, in pixels.
eventsFunctions.name: AttackRange

eventsFunctions.description: Set the direction of the attack relative to the character (Left, Right, Up or Down).
eventsFunctions.name: SetAttackDirection

parameters.longDescription: The direction of the attack relative to the character, which is either Left, Right, Up, or Down
parameters.name: Direction

eventsFunctions.description: Get the direction of the attack relative to the character (Left, Right, Up or Down).
eventsFunctions.name: AttackDirection

eventsFunctions.description: Set the speed of the firing attack, in pixels per second.
eventsFunctions.name: SetAttackSpeed
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the _PARAM0_ firing attack speed to _PARAM2_ px/s

parameters.longDescription: The speed of the firing attack, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.description: Get the speed of the firing attack, in pixels per second.
eventsFunctions.name: AttackSpeed

eventsFunctions.description: Get the kill count for the object.
eventsFunctions.name: KillCount

eventsFunctions.description: Get the death count for the object.
eventsFunctions.name: DeathCount

eventsFunctions.description: Resets the death and kill counts.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetCounts
eventsFunctions.sentence: Reset the _PARAM0_ death and kill count

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is firing a weapon.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFiring

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is swinging a weapon.
eventsFunctions.name: IsSwinging

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is attacking.
eventsFunctions.name: IsAttacking

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object has just attacked.
eventsFunctions.name: HasJustAttacked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object has damaged the target.
eventsFunctions.name: HasDamagedTarget

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is ready to attack.
eventsFunctions.name: IsReadyToAttack

eventsFunctions.description: Check that the target is in range and that the object is facing the target.
eventsFunctions.name: IsInRange

eventsFunctions.description: Fire a weapon with a bullet in a direction (Left, Right, Up, or Down).
eventsFunctions.name: FireInDirection
eventsFunctions.sentence: Have _PARAM0_ fire _PARAM2_ from _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_ with bullet _PARAM6_ in direction _PARAM7_

eventsFunctions.description: Fire a weapon with a bullet at a target.
eventsFunctions.name: FireAtTarget
eventsFunctions.sentence: Have _PARAM0_ fire _PARAM2_ from _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_ with bullet _PARAM6_ at target _PARAM7_

propertyDescriptors.label: How often to attack, in seconds
propertyDescriptors.name: AttackInterval

propertyDescriptors.label: The direction of the attack relative to the character (Left, Right, Up, or Down)
propertyDescriptors.name: AttackDirection

propertyDescriptors.label: Speed of the firing attack, in pixels per second
propertyDescriptors.name: AttackSpeed

propertyDescriptors.label: Rotate object to face in the attack direction
propertyDescriptors.name: RotateDirection

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: An item that can be held by another object at a specific point.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: HandheldItem

eventsFunctions.description: Pick up the item by another object at the specified point.
eventsFunctions.name: PickUp

parameters.longDescription: Name of the point on the holding object where the item is held ("Origin", "Center", or a custom point name)
parameters.name: Point

eventsFunctions.description: Put down the item.
eventsFunctions.name: PutDown

propertyDescriptors.label: Follow the rotation of the holding object
propertyDescriptors.name: FollowRotation

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: An item that can swing in an arc from a starting angle, like a sword.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SwingingItem

eventsFunctions.description: Swing the item in an arc from the starting angle.
eventsFunctions.name: SwingItem

eventsFunctions.description: Set the starting angle for the swing.
eventsFunctions.name: SetStartingAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Get the starting angle for the swing.
eventsFunctions.name: StartingAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Set the total degrees in the swing's arc.
eventsFunctions.name: SetSwingArc

parameters.description: Total degrees in the swing's arc
parameters.name: SwingArc

eventsFunctions.description: Get the total degrees in the swing's arc.
eventsFunctions.name: SwingArc

eventsFunctions.description: Set the swing speed, in degrees per frame.
eventsFunctions.name: SetSwingSpeed

parameters.longDescription: The speed of the swing, in degrees per-frame. Can be negative to swing in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: SwingSpeed

eventsFunctions.description: Get the swing speed, in degrees per frame.
eventsFunctions.name: SwingSpeed

propertyDescriptors.label: Total degrees in the swing's arc
propertyDescriptors.name: SwingArc

propertyDescriptors.label: Swing speed, in degrees per frame. Can be negative to swing in the opposite direction.
propertyDescriptors.name: SwingSpeed

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Paints a health bar which can optionally follow above a character.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: HealthBar

eventsFunctions.description: Update the health bar display based on the health of the character.
eventsFunctions.name: Update

propertyDescriptors.label: Float the health bar above the character
propertyDescriptors.name: FloatAbove

propertyDescriptors.label: Height above the center of the character to float the health bar
propertyDescriptors.name: FloatHeight
